decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Design & Access Statement, 01, 02, 10, 11, 20, 101, 102, 103, 300 Received: 27 March 2014  200 Rev. A, 201 Rev. A Received: 31 March 2014 Flood Risk Assessment, Flood Risk Zone Map, 099, 100 Received: 14 April 2014) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 0800 to 1800 on Mondays to Friday and 0800 to 1300 on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the side walls of the extension hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - The development hereby permitted shall only be carried out in accordance with the approved Flood Risk Assessment produced and provided with the application and the basement shall not be occupied until all the measures in the Flood Risk Assessment are implemented.

Condition : 7 - No excavation or construction work shall be undertaken prior to the submission and approval in writing by the Local Planning Authority, of a Construction Method Statement, which is certified by a qualified professional, giving specific details of excavation, temporary works and construction techniques, including details of potential impacts on neighbouring land based on assessment of the geology and hydrology of the area.
description: Demolition of the single storey rear extension, erection of a part single part two storey side and rear extension, creation of a basement, conversion of garage to habitable room and associated external works to front elevation.
